data.title: A great place to visit.
data.text: We only saw a few places in the square.  The building itself is quite impressive and well worth the visit.

data.title: Center City at Market and Broad
data.text: Great big old building...very impressive and worthwhile to drive around it...but busy traffic.  Did not go inside.

data.title: Beautiful to look at.
data.text: Our hotel, The Ritz-Carlton was right across the street and it was beautiful day and night. A lot of student protesters in the area. It is only two days from election day.

data.title: Awesome historic building.
data.text: Great stop to take. Building still serves as city hall for Philly. Amazing marble and stone work on building that took many years to complete. Another don't miss is Philly.

data.title: Beautiful Building
data.text: We were here on a weekend so were not able to take a tour. We still enjoyed walking around the exterior and the interior courtyard to take in the beautiful architecture, not to mention the many beautiful historic buildings adjacent to it.

data.title: A must see for visitors
data.text: Great place to visit.  The Architecture will not disappoint.  The Ice Skating Rink is getting put up now and the Christmas Village is a great thing to see as well.

data.title: Beautiful Building. Not Convenient to Tour.
data.text:
This building is beautiful.  And if you like to take photos of beautiful architecture, I’d recommend bringing your camera…or phone.  There are a couple of ways to tour the facility.  

Once daily there is a two hour 12:30 pm tour.  We were not able to take this tour, but there is a tower tour that leaves every 15 minutes that lasts for 45 minutes.  Even though you can book in advance, it isn’t the easiest tour to get into.  The day we were there the tours were booked for the day.  You cannot buy advance tickets from the Visitor Center.  You can buy tickets in advance online but it must be the day of the tour.  We were never able to get a tour.  There needs to be better method of purchasing tickets.

data.title: Building for the city
data.text: Massive building with nice infrastructure, located near by Phila attractions. Penn monument is next to.

data.title: Incredible Building
data.text: An amazing structure in the heart of Philadelphia. Well worth visiting and taking a tour. Just great to photograph.

data.title: LOVE sculpture by Robert Indiana
data.text: Some wonderful sculptures and architecture. Best part: it's free! easy to get to since it is a hub for buses and subway.

data.title: Excellent Tour.
data.text:
Fascinating insight into both the building and the history of the City during the tour given by enthusiastic guides.

Combine with a trip to the top of the tower for great value and unbeatable views of the City.

data.title: See it!
data.text: Make sure to go inside the hallways and look at the old photographs of when City Hall was built. Really interesting.

data.title: Landmark
data.text: Can be seen from all over Philadelphia. Topped by a staue of the the states founder William Penn. Walk through the central courtyard.

data.title: the world's tallest town hall
data.text: It is immediately recognizable the imposing and the world's tallest town hall when you are in the city center.

data.title: Nice Architecture and Insight into Philly
data.text: This is a sight you need to see so you can say you've experienced some of the heart of Philadelphia. This is a landmark that must not be missed. There's so much history here.

data.title: Amazing views of the city!
data.text: The City Hall is a beautiful building!   The highlight of my visit to City Hall was going up in the tower to see a 360 degree view of Philadelphia.  Our guide was quite knowledgeable and made the tour even better.

data.title: City Hall - is the finest sights of all.
data.text: City Hall - is the finest sights of all. All the best historic sculptures are represented here. It's like visiting a Museum of a top level. Everyone adores it! You can do it too!

data.title: Philadelphia meets Paris
data.text: Don't be put off by the "city hall" moniker. This is a truly fascinating building all around. I felt like I was in Paris. Such grandeur! Such intricate design and style! Do NOT miss the statuary to be found around/throughout. All I can say is go experience this place. So many visual surprises.

data.title: Walk through history...
data.text: The thing I love most is that a part of history can be a part of your first visit to the city or your daily walk if you live here. With an open courtyard, there is the ability to sit and read, take in the historical plaques that adorn the walls or sit back on any given day and listen to the free entertainment by the talented street musician. On Sundays in the summertime, the sidewalks thought to be barren concrete erupt with water spouts, giving children their own little water world in the city. Refreshing for all ages actually! It is a location that is used for any number of events. A part of history gets to be a part of your day. I live here and go by or through it once a week.

data.title: Worthwhile for city views from observation deck and seeing Billy Penn "up close"
data.text: I live locally and enjoy taking visitors to see City Hall. It's the tallest city hall in the US. Admission is nominal - $ 4 children/$6 adults or included with the Phila pass. The observation deck has super views of the city and you can look up and check out the statue a little more close up. Up until about 30 years ago- by city ordinance- no building in the City of Philadelphia could be taller than the brim of William Penn's hat atop city hall. Legend has it that when buildings starting going higher the luck of the Philadelphia sports teams tanked. When the tallest building in Philadelphia (currently the Comcast Center) was  built iron workers mounted a small statue of William Penn to the very top of the building- restoring some luck to Philadelphia teams-- City is beautiful. Especially at Christmas when the interior courtyard is decorated and in recent years an open air type of German style  Christmas market is opened around the perimeter. There is also an ice rink that goes up at the same time. It's a lovely spot to visit- shouldn't take more than an hour at most.
